article:
:Not to be confused with [[extracellular space|intercellular]], meaning "between
cells". In cell biology, molecular biology and related fields, the word
'intracellular' means "inside the cell".

It is used in contrast to extracellular (outside the cell). The cell membrane
(and, in many organisms, the cell wall) is the barrier between the two, and
chemical composition of intra- and extracellular milieu can be radically
different. In most organisms, for example, a Na+/K+ ATPase maintains a high
potassium level inside cells while keeping sodium low, leading to chemical
excitability.
This terms also means existing within the cells.
